lexUnit.name: totter.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move in an unsteady way, such that the moving entity seems ready to fall over

sentence.text: Then , in the silence , Bigwig lurched to his feet , swayed a moment , tottered a few steps towards Fiver and fell again .

Then it happens to another dancer and , as I am watching the same pattern of recovery , the man next to me throws his arms into the air , totters forward and begins to experience apparently involuntary spasms .
a knight totters forward and then to the left
I tottered across to a cottage on the edge of the loch and asked for a pot of tea and a bite to eat .
Grumbling to herself , she put on her dressing-gown and tottered downstairs , filled a kettle and rummaged in a drawer for aspirin .
After a delightful supper we just tottered across the forecourt of the Savoy Grill into the Savoy Theatre -- very intimate -- and we saw a nice show .
Charlotte came forward to greet Ruth , little Enoch at fourteen months tottering unsteadily behind her .
She tottered through the open door .
As they tottered through the trees this Wednesday morning , she felt herself shaking from somewhere deep inside .
Together they tottered to the door .
Then he tottered to the home , polybag empty of crusts .
The two girls totter to the lavatory door , laughing at the funniest thing they 've seen since Grandma sat on her chihuahua .
On May 10th , 38 people tottered to the top , took a quick look at the view and scrambled down again .
The latest news from Baden Baden is that the poor old devil is just about able to totter to the pump house . "
That made me feel a bit better , so I tottered to the top of the hill and stared bleakly around , in the equally bleak daylight .
The other travellers tottered towards him through the throng of birds .
I shrank back while the fortune teller tottered towards the main street .
One of them comes tottering up to him , falls , and pitches a red plastic fire-engine at his feet .
It was crowded all through the day and Melanie and Aunt Margaret tottered on burning feet by the time they turned the sign on the door round to read ` closed " .
Would you like me to totter along a white line ?
Fimir nodded and tottered away .
He steadied it with one hand whilst with the other he slammed the doors , then holding the handle of the basket , he tottered away .

When I see a woman in a long , tight , pencil skirt and high heels tottering down the road , I often wonder how fast she could run if chased .
As Magee watched she tottered down the steps and wandered off down Duncannon Street in the direction of the Strand .
Athelstan , using all his weight , pushed Sir John back and sent him tottering down the corridor .
At that moment Mauleverer tottered in and made for the armchair beside the fire .

He watched the grey-blue Mediterranean rise and fall , the gardener totter over the withered grass , and elderly couples , who formed the majority of residents in the hotel , walk stiff-legged along the mole which jutted out fifty yards into the sea .
Nicola tottered round the table on her high heels and slid her buttocks on to the table .

As the inebriated insect totters up , it has to wriggle beneath an overhanging rod which showers it with pollen .
When I look back I could weep -- dear little things tottering about on beaches .
How stupid to have been caught tottering about like an invalid .
As he tottered back to his seat it was as much as I could do not to applaud .
She looked a trifle dazed and who could blame her , but after a minute or so she was on her feet again and tottering back towards the playground .
Then clutching his suitcase , he tottered down on to the platform .

Then she tottered off on her four-inch heels .
When I am ready for residential care , I may totter over to that side of the House , but until then I am happy to stay on this side .

Mary tottered up on her perch from side to side but nothing wiped the mild , sweet benignity from her doll 's face as she dropped the dew of her mercy down from heaven on the mortal exiles below wailing and weeping in the vale of tears .
Elliott clutched Goldman 's shoulders from behind and got him half-way to his feet before Goldman tottered backwards and sat down heavily .
She totters forward , in she goes
